patterns: Which kind of animal does lumpy disease affect
What is the mortality of an animal with this disease
responses: Lumpy skin disease is a highly contagious disease viral in cattle and has low mortality

patterns: How to treat an animal with lumpy skin
responses: This is done by culling  all infected animal and movement of controls to prevent spread

patterns: What animal does foot and mouth affect
responses: Foot and mouth is a highly contagious disease affecting cattle and other cloven hoofed animals

patterns: What are the symptoms of  foot and mouth
responses: Its symptoms include fever, blisters on the tongue and lips, in the mouth, on the teats and between hooves, lameness or loss of mobility

patterns: How to treat an animal with foot and mouth
responses: This is done by culling  all infected animal and movement of controls to prevent spread Sorry but there is no cure for this disease  but supportive drugs can be used such as anti-inflamatory and antibiotics

patterns: my cow has blisters in the mouth and between the hooves
What diseases in cows has sypmtoms like blisters between hoovesor on the  tongue and lips and also causes lameness
responses: Foot and mouth is the most probable disease affecting your cow

patterns: What are the diseases affecting dogs
responses: Diseases affecting dogs include rabies, distemper, parvovirus, lyme disease

patterns: What are the symptoms of rabies
responses: Symptoms of rabies include fever, seizures, paralysis, hydrophobia, jaw is dropped and there is loss of muscle coordination

patterns: What are the symptoms of distemper
responses: Symptoms of distemper include coughing, diarrhea,vomiting, seizures and paralysis.

patterns: What are the symptoms of parvovirus
responses: Symptoms of parvovirus include lethargy, vomiting,diarrhea(often bloody), and fever.

patterns: What are the symptoms of lyme disease
responses: Symptoms of lyme disease include fever, lethargy, swollen lymph nodes and lameness

patterns: What are the diseases affecting  Cat
responses: Common diseases affecting cats are Feline leukemia virus,feline infectious peritonitis, feline lower urinary tract disease

patterns: What are the symptoms of feline leukemia
responses: Symptoms of feline leukemia include anemia, weight loss, lethargy and diarrhea.

patterns: What are the symptoms of feline immunodeficiency Virus
responses: Symptoms include fever, lethargy, swollen lymph nodes and weight loss

patterns: What are the symptoms of feline infectious peritonitis
responses: They include fever, lethargy, anorexia and weight loss

patterns: What is  feline lower urinary tract disease
What are the symptoms of  feline lower urinary tract disease
responses: They include straining to urinate, frequent urination, blood in urine.

patterns: my cat is suffering from a fever
responses: Your cat might be suffering from feline infectious peritonitis,feline immunodeficiency Virus

patterns: My cat is  straining to urinate or frequent urination or blood in urine.
my cat is suffering from a fever
responses: Your cat has  feline lower urinary tract disease

responses: Your cat might be suffering from either  feline immunodeficiency Virus or feline leukemia

patterns: causes hair loss, itching, and skin lesions in cats
responses: symptoms may be associated with a condition called flea allergy dermatitis, which occurs when cats develop an allergic reaction to flea bites,Treatment includes flea control measures, such as topical treatments, oral medications, and environmental management to eliminate fleas from the cat's environment.

patterns: My cat is experiencing weight loss, increased thirst, and frequent urination
responses: These symptoms can be associated with feline diabetes mellitus, a condition caused by an inadequate production or utilization of insulin and treatment often includes insulin injections, dietary management, and weight control strategies.
